title: Canoe

verbs: To traverse or travel by ship on a body of water.
Traverse or travel on (a body of water)
To be impelled or driven forward by the action of wind upon sails, as a ship on water; to be impelled on a body of water by steam or other power.
nouns: A small long and narrow boat, propelled by one or more people (depending on the size of canoe), using single-bladed paddles. The paddlers face in the direction of travel, in either a seated position, or kneeling on the bottom of the boat. Canoes are open on top, and pointed at both ends.
Small and light boat; pointed at both ends; propelled with a paddle
A canoe is a lightweight narrow boat, typically pointed at both ends and open on top, propelled by one or more seated or kneeling paddlers facing the direction of travel using a single-bladed paddle.
A light narrow boat driven by a paddle.
A boat is a watercraft, usually smaller than most ships.
A watercraft designed to float or plane on, and provide transport over water.
A boat is a watercraft of any size designed to float or plane, to work or travel on water.
A small vessel for travel on water

description:
A narrow lightweight water vessel that is usually pointed on both ends and made of either wood or plastic.

Generally depicted with a paddle.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's canoe emoji floats with a sense of serene adventure, its sleek, polished wooden hull reflecting light with a realistic gleam. The design features soft, rounded edges and smooth gradients that suggest a smooth glide through water, embodying tranquility and exploration. On Apple devices, this emoji evokes feelings of outdoor recreation, peaceful journeys, or a desire for nature and escape.
